Milk and Honey æœç„¶å¥¶å…±

Ukraine : Ukraine and People's Republic of China sign bilateral treaties on requirements for honey and meal exports from Ukraine to the PRC
MENA Report; London (Dec 6, 2019).


During the Seventh Session of the Ukrainian-Chinese Subcommittee on Agricultural Cooperation, held in Beijing on November 27, 2019, a Protocol on veterinary and phytosanitary requirements for the export of rapeseed meal from Ukraine to the People's Republic of China was signed Of Ukraine on Food Safety and Consumer Protection and the Main Customs Directorate of the People's Republic of China and the Protocol between the State Security Service of Ukraine Food and Consumer Protection and the Main Customs Directorate of the People's Republic of China on requirements for honey exported from Ukraine to the PRC.



On the Ukrainian side, the Protocol was signed by Taras Kachka, Deputy Minister for Economic Development, Trade and Agriculture of Ukraine - Taras Kachka, Trade Representative of Ukraine, and Van Lingzhun, Deputy Minister of Customs of the People's Republic of China, on the Chinese side.



The signing of these protocols will help to intensify and establish bilateral trade, diversify markets between Ukraine and the People's Republic of China and open new opportunities for Ukrainian business and exporters, as well as strengthen ties between the two countries.

The Supernatural in Vernacular Contexts
Anyone who is familiar with ukrainian and russian cultures and knows that the so- called rational, logical, and science-oriented paradigm of thinking is heavily reinforced by state institutions may find it paradoxical that the supernatural is incorporated into the highest-level political discourses involving these very institutions. An outsider may wonder how one of ukraine’s most reputable news services can report the views of astrologers and tarot card readers without fear of being accused of silliness and lack of professionalism. one may also wonder how the pro-kremlin channels not only broadcast things supernatural, but also place the supernatural at the center of the current russian government’s national and international geopolitical agendas.

(Hope for ukraine, Fall of America, and Putin the Savior: The Supernatural in ukrainian and russian media and Vernacular contexts,
mariya lesiv)
